approval_data.project_name: V-KYC recordings to be fetched for Audit requirements
approval_data.project_summary: Develop a portal/dashboard for V-KYC team leads to access and download V-KYC recordings for audit purposes.
project_goals: Provide easy access to V-KYC recordings for audit requirements.
Reduce dependency on IT for retrieving recordings.
Improve efficiency in accessing and managing V-KYC recordings.
approval_data.business_context: The V-KYC team currently relies on the IT data server team to provide recordings, which are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server. This manual process is time-consuming and inefficient, especially for audit requirements.

requirements.description: A portal/dashboard should be created for accessing V-KYC recordings.
Access to the portal should be provided to V-KYC team leads and Process Managers.
All V-KYC recordings should be available on the portal.
Recordings should be searchable by LAN ID.
Recordings should be searchable by date and month.
Users should be able to upload an Excel or text file with up to 50 LAN IDs for bulk download.
The system should trigger a backend API call to process the bulk download request.
Results of the bulk download request should be displayed in a tabular format with a 'Download All' option.
The table should display a maximum of 10 records per page.
A maximum of 10 records should be downloaded at a time.
The file upload should accept CSV/TXT file formats.

functional_requirements: Search functionality by LAN ID, date, and month.
Bulk download functionality with file upload.
Display of recording details (User ID, Call Duration, Status, Time, Date, NFS VKYC Upload Time).
success_criteria: Easy access to V-KYC recordings for authorized users.
Accuracy and completeness of recording retrieval.
constraints: Recordings are stored on the LTF ‘NFS(Network File System)’ server.
Access to the screen will be available to very limited users (only Team leaders)
File will contain min 2 and maxmium 50 LanIDs
assumptions: The existing infrastructure (NFS server, network) will be available and operational.
The backend API for processing requests will be available and functional.
risks: Data security and privacy concerns related to accessing and downloading recordings.
Performance issues with bulk downloads if the system is not optimized.
Compatibility issues with different file formats for upload.
